utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Um, I was just trying on my Halloween costume.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What exactly are you supposed to be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Space Cowboy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. A, there are no cows in space. B, didn’t you, like, wear that five years ago?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So, don’t you think you should move on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like it. What are you doing up so late anyway?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Halloween homework. "The Pit and the Pendulum", the original Saw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you decided what you're going to dress up as this year? Perhaps Indira Gandhi? Amelia Earhart? Oh, Hermione?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I think I’m going to skip it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Skip Halloween?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, dressing up. I’ll still hand out candy at the door but I’m too old to go trick or treating anymore. You know how I feel when the big kids come. I don’t want to be that kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you have to go with me. You are my candy beard.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sorry. Dad. You're just going to have to get another beard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This discussion is not over. So, have you come up with a name for your parenting project baby egg yet? Uhh, let me guess. Zac Eggron? No. Egg Begley Junior?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I went Dickensian. Paige and I are calling him Feggin. Get it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Feggin?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fake baby egg.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t that be fak-egg-in? Beckett, what are you doing up so late?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just love this time of year. Crunchy leaves underfoot, the crisp clean air, the smell of jack-o-lanterns all aflame.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you wouldn’t say that if you were a cop. Halloween is one of the worst weeks of the year for us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm, since the body is already in a graveyard, someone’s trying to save some time. I do love walking through cemeteries. All of the stories. Check out this one. Elizabeth Dryden, December 3rd, 1962 to question mark. If they don’t even know when she died, what’s buried here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you wearing suspenders?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I’m trying on costumes for my annual Halloween party. Costumes are mandatory.

utterance.speaker: DR LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Take a look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wowch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? Is that a stake in his heart?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Buffy’s visited the Big Apple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone thought he was a vampire.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So did he. And they are not plastic pop-ins either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you telling me those are real?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Or high-end veneers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or he’s a vampire.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No ID, no phone, we’ve got guys sweeping the area for anything they can find.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: No witnesses either.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like he struggled. I’m thinking he hit his head on this stone or someone knocked him in the head before he was stabbed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who would go to the trouble of killing someone that way?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lycans. They’ve been at war with the vampires since Lucian was murdered in the fifteenth century.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What is wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If he’s a vampire and you pull that out, he comes back to life.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If he does then we can all go home early.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea as to who or what he is?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He’s human, and the fangs are ceramic veneers. But he has two fresh avulsions near the femoral artery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bite marks on his thigh?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And I found these on his body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It can’t be easy to drive a stake through someone’s chest.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: To break the rib cage you’d have to pound it in with a rock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone didn’t wash their hands before the stabbing. Look at these black smudges.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, have CSU run the stake. Any match on the vic's prints?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nothing in the system, no hits with missing persons, no ID.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he has professional veneers.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know the best fang master in the city. Maybe he could identify him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fang master?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hope this is for real, Castle, because if it’s not we are short changing our John Doe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, trust me, I can’t believe you've never heard of this place. I get all my costumes here. Ahh, we can use this opportunity to find you one for my Halloween party. How about slutty nurse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fantasise all you want, Castle, I’m not trying on costumes for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No? Why not? You already got one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who says I’m even coming to your party?

utterance.speaker: DR BARRY FRANK
utterance.content: Richard Castle, changed your mind? I’d love to fit you with a nice set of doubles.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Official police business today, Doc. Detective Beckett, I’d like to introduce to you Doctor Barry Frank, dental genius and fang master extraordinaire. He did Brad Pitt’s veneers for Interview with a Vampire.

utterance.speaker: DR FRANK
utterance.content: So what can I do for you? The master is in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We're investigating a homicide and our victim had some work done. We were hoping you could help identify him.

utterance.speaker: DR FRANK
utterance.content: Oh, that’s Crow. I did his veneers, I don’t know, about two months ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crow?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People in the vampire fetish community, they give up their mundane names. You're not going to find any Daves or Chucks or Megs here.

utterance.speaker: DR FRANK
utterance.content: He seemed like a nice kid, what happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what we're trying to figure out. We were hoping you would have a legal name or a billing address?

utterance.speaker: DR FRANK
utterance.content: Sure, just let me look it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: This is Matthew’s apartment. You’d think he’d be trouble but Matthew was a quiet kid, shy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Had you heard or seen anything unusual lately?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: The vampire thing was a little weird, but my first husband was a Civil War re-enactor so you tell me, which is weirder?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Yeah, but mostly comic books.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Reminds me of early Frank Miller.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which Frank? Epic Comic or Dark Horse years?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God, that is the sexiest thing I ever heard you say. I had no idea you were interested in comic books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle, the things you don’t know about me could fill a book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, check this out. He was developing a graphic novel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s talented. Did Crow ever talk about his family?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Well, he never mentioned any. I just figured he was pretty much on his own. A loner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like he went to The Barker School of Design.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he have any friends or visitors to his apartment?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: He brought a girl here once or twice. She was one of them. You could see them when she smiled. They did have a big fight the other night, she was screaming bloody murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did she look like?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: She had long black hair to her tush.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Long black hair?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a name?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: No, he told me that she was famous or something. He said she had her own website on the internet. Well, we could check his browser history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm, do you think they're real? The fangs, I mean.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Vampire Mistress Vixen. Her coven is called The Den of Iniquity.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Coven?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, a vampire coven is like joining a church or a club. You like to play golf, I like to play golf. You like to drink blood, I like to drink blood. What? I used to go out with a girl who was into the lifestyle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What happened? Did the relationship suck?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Deal breaker, she wanted to have sex in a coffin. I’m open minded, I’m not that open minded.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Did our mistress of the night have a phone number or an address?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only an email. However, there is information on the coven’s next gathering, which meets tonight. Damn, you need a password.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or an old girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey whoa, I haven’t seen her in like a year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re sanguinarians? Blood drinkers.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: All of our blood play is legal and consensual.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not here about the club. Do you know somebody named Matthew Freeman?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crow.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: Crow? Sure why, is he in some kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found him in a cemetery. Someone put a stake through his heart.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: What is this, some kind of joke? Let's go make fun of the vampires?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not a joke.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: No way. What? Who would want to kill Crow like that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were hoping you could tell us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between 11PM and midnight?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: I was here. Wait, you don’t think I’m responsible?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found synthetic hairs on his body from a black wig. And bites on his thigh.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: But I didn’t kill him. He was one of my lovers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you saw him yesterday?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: Mid afternoon. He left at 3:30. Oh my God, it’s so awful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vixen.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: Is he really dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have a witness who told us you were fighting recently.

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: Yes, because he’d been seeing someone else. Ultimately we forgave him. Yesterday, we were… making up. That’s why you found my hair on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said he was seeing someone else?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: Damon. Damon fell in love with Crow and his art. He talked him into writing a graphic novel. That’s why he’s dead, their graphic novel. Blood Everlasting, it’s about a vampire in New York City. Only the guy that they were basing it on was real. And dangerous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A real vampire?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: He thinks he is. His name’s Morgan Lockerbie, he was an original member of this coven but something happened to him. He lost all hold of reality, he started believing that this was real. Now he only comes out a night and hangs out at the cemetery. . It was just crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do we find this Lockerbie?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: He’s homeless, but Damon probably knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Damon have a last name?

utterance.speaker: VIXEN
utterance.content: I don’t know his real name. He was Crow’s boyfriend, not mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, what is it with these people and their dressing up like vampires? The covens, the drama?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not about the costumes or the make up. A lot of the people who are committed to the fantasy are a little different. They're just looking for a place to fit in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, that I get. It’s just this whole fascination with the macabre. The drinking of the blood, the sharing of the blood, the, ah, having sex in coffins?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Psychology 101. They probably had something happen to them when they were younger. Maybe they saw their dog get hit by a car, attended an open casket funeral, the loss of a childhood friend…or parent? Some people become vampires, some people become cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, so where did your fascination with the macabre come from? What happened to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, Morgan Lockerbie, run him and see what you can find. And see if you can find Crow’s friend Damon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Does he have a last name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not even sure that’s his real first name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hate this part. It’s the phone call that changes everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I could stay if you like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. No. Thank you, sometimes it’s easier without an audience.

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: No. Matthew was very private about his life. There was little we knew about his so-called friends.

utterance.speaker: ROSIE FREEMAN
utterance.content: Mom.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: I knew those people were dangerous. I should have stopped him from getting involved.

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: Alan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was registered at The Barker School of Design. Did he ever attend?

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: No, he dropped out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time you saw Matthew?

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: It’s been months since we’ve seen Matthew. No, it was Crow now.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: He came home, he was dressed in black, he had skulls tattooed on his arm, eyeliner on his eyes, fangs. I should have gotten tougher on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did you hear from him last?

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: He called a couple of days ago and left a message. He sounded upset.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: We never found out why.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tough one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re all tough. So, you got anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, Vixen’s alibi checks out. Talking to Crow’s coven friends and searching through vampire websites. So far no Damon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Lockerbie?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Morgan Lockerbie, psychiatric disorder, thirty-five, committed by the state. That’s the good news. Bad news is, he escaped a few years back. Nobody has seen him since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got an address on file?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, he’s completely off grid. What’s your shadow doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, last time I saw him he was sifting through evidence from Crow’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, are you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His Halloween party?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, he throws a lot of parties. You?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I’m all over that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you going to wear?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You wanna know? You gotta show, to see what I’ve got going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito found Morgan Lockerbie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean Morlock?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: O…. Kay….

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did you get a hit on?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The prints from the stake in Crow’s heart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Morgan Lockerbie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The only thing is he’s one of the great unfindables, no address, no phone number, no trail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe not. Here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Broome and Clinton, lower east side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think Crow may have drawn us a roadmap to Morlock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve gotta be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think he’s in there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It is daytime. He thinks he’s a vampire, it’s where he’ll be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll cover you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Together?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, on three.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you see him jump?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Real macho, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get him off, get him off me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He bit me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He is a vampire.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He’s not a vampire.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But his skin burned when the light hit him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He has porphyria. Some people call it the vampire disease. Its symptoms include extreme photosensitivity. The skin blisters when it’s exposed to the sun. Victims are prone to hallucinations, paranoia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains his psych diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly how contagious is it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s a genetic disease. Besides, I put enough antibiotics on that bite to kill a small animal. Now if we’re done here, I’ve gotta head back to the lab to see a man about a corpse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr Parish. Castle was totally freaked out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wanna bite me, you buy me dinner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr Lockerbie. Morlock, do you know somebody named Crow?

utterance.speaker: MORLOCK
utterance.content: Heartless *****. Spots all over, spots all over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you in the cemetery with Crow?

utterance.speaker: MORLOCK
utterance.content: Blood all over, blood all over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s been a murder, Mr Lockerbie, do you understand that? Were you in the cemetery with Crow? We found a wooden stake with your finger prints all over it.

utterance.speaker: MORLOCK
utterance.content: Just get in the crypt and kill the bird. I should have buried you then, you wicked boy, I should have buried you then. I didn’t see him, I didn’t see him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t want to tell the public defender how to do her job, but the insanity plea might be appropriate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe the state psychiatrist can help us make sense out of Morlock’s rantings before they take him away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: India ink?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: India ink or Chinese ink has been used since fourth century BC when it was called Maasi. It’s water resistant so it won’t smudge when coloured over. It’s also the ink used by letterers in comic books. So if Crow was the illustrator...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then Crow’s friend Damon was the letterer. But what would the ink be doing on the stake?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What indeed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? Where are we on the friend?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re working on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, could you work a little faster?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castle, you wanna help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would love to, but I’ve got bigger pumpkins to carve.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How’s your Nosferatu coming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The key to a good Jack-o-lantern is understanding negative space.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s not what’s there, it’s what’s not-there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve taught you well, grasshopper.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: What are my two pumpkin masters carving for this year's party?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m carving the traditional Jack-o-lantern, Mr Scary Pumpkin Face.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I’m carving Max Schreck in his role as Count Orlock.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad’s a little vampire obsessed because of his case… or maybe it’s because of the bite.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I swear you've missed your calling. I don’t know why you even bother to write.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You wanna carve with us?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Can’t. I’m off to a masquerade ball. Perhaps I’ll meet my Gatsby?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ooh hoo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, Mother, I’m impressed. You still fit into your prom dress.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, thank you darling. Have you asked him yet?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was waiting for the right moment.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ask me what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Paige and I got invited to a party tomorrow, the night before Halloween. By seniors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By your grandmother's friends?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No Dad, twelfth graders. But it will be supervised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is one of those crossroads moments, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, let her go. She’s far more responsible than you ever were.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, you can go. But if anything happens that makes you feel uncomfortable, anything at all, you call me. I don’t care what it is, and there will be no punishments, no recriminations, nothing, I promise, just so long as you call.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, I’ll call, but nothing’s going to happen. But there is one more thing, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? Is he going to hatch?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Our health teacher says that we can’t leave him alone, that’s considered egg abuse. And since Paige and I are co-parenting, and we're both going to the party and her parents are going out, we need a sitter.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no, sorry. Plans.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, OK. I’ll watch your little egg child. But I want you to know I’m far too young to be a grandparent. And if any of those senior boys bother you, Father won’t quite be himself.

utterance.speaker: DR HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Although someone like Mr Lockerbie will present as completely non compos mentis, he could still have moments of complete lucidity. The difficulty is separating the fantasy from the reality.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, these were drawn by our victim. I was wondering if they suggested anything about his relationship with Mr Lockerbie?

utterance.speaker: DR HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: I’d have to study them more to give you a diagnosis, but these are more about the woman in the drawings than Lockerbie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: DR HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: He draws her as an angel, but always in the context of an act of violence. Honesty, it looks to me like the work of someone who was once traumatised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, childhood trauma. What I’d tell you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doc Holloway, this is Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doctor Holloway.

utterance.speaker: DR HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: I’ll arrange for someone from social services to come and get Mr Lockerbie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eat my own grandchild? What am I, a monster?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe that bite was catching?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a school health sciences project helping de-romanticise having a family before you're ready to take responsibility. Alexis and Paige go to their first senior party tonight so I’m babysitting. Ah no, egg-sitting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Senior party, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Silver bullet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, nine millimetre.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then I guess he’s not a real werewolf.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nice. The hairs on his face and hands are synthetic attached with spirit gum. It’s a Halloween costume.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to his driver's licence, Damon’s real name was Jonas Westfall. He’s a graduate student NYU, in forensic anthropology.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then that explains the bones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, don’t touch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Canvassed the building, neighbour remembers hearing something the other day but thought it was a car backfiring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The other day?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on deterioration and lividity and the smell of that old Thai food, wolf boy was killed the same day as our vampire. I’d say a couple of hours before.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I assume there’s a connection?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. India ink. Which means Crow’s killer was in the apartment, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But what were they looking for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Morlock? He comes here, shoots Damon, grabs a stake, goes off and kills Crow?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And in the struggle the ink bottle is broken.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It wasn’t Morlock. This victim was killed during the day. Morlock had prophyria, he would have burned to a crisp.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then if he didn’t kill our werewolf…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then chances are he didn’t kill our vampire.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then how did the prints get on the stake?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he was trying to help him, maybe he was trying to save his friend? Are you sure about the time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: His watch broke when he fell; it says four o’clock, October 27th.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then if it wasn’t Morlock, who was it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what were they looking for?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t know what they were looking for but I think I know what our vic was hiding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Jonas Westfall AKA Damon was inches away from getting his masters in forensic science from NYU.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This all looks like part of his research. You know, I went through a bone collecting phase when I was a kid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, whatever happened to you, happened when you were young. What was it, Castle? Did you witness a murder or did you skin your knee and it bled?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of trauma, I wonder how late Alexis is going to be at her party? Feggin is suffering from separation issues.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, Castle. You know mine. *** for tat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just because I’ve seen your tat doesn’t mean I’m going to show you my…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Based on the remains, investigators have attempted a forensic reconstruction of the murdered woman’s face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the woman from Crow’s drawings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet in the graphic novel she consistently appears as the angel of death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, so Crow became obsessed by Damon’s case study; why would they go to this much trouble to hide it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would someone kill to find it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No that’s impossible. This body wasn’t discovered until two years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So either Crow is psychic or…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He knew this woman before she died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m on my way.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh my God, is she all right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. She was swapping drinks for kisses and I tried to pull her away but she wouldn’t let me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could you get me a glass of water?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Paige.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, are you sure she hasn’t been throwing up or unconscious?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, just falling down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Call her parents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is she saying?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s just drunk talk. She just saying don’t call her parents or they’ll murder her, just let her sleep over. Do we have to call her parents?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We do. Get me their number.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She’ll get in so much trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Less than if you had left her there. Now.

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: Adora, that’s what he called her. We’ve seen her in Matthew’s artwork for years.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: We assumed that she was just a figment of his imagination.

utterance.speaker: ROSIE FREEMAN
utterance.content: He called her his own personal ghost. He said she appeared in his dreams and nightmares.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she’s not a figment, she’s very real. Are you sure you don’t recognise her? Because she could be anybody. She could be a teacher, neighbour…

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: No, I’m certain. We’ve only seen her in his art.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know if your son experienced anything traumatic when he was younger?

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I showed some of Matthew’s drawings to one of our therapists, and he said it looked like he might have witnessed something disturbing, seen something very violent.

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: I really can’t think of anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any of Matthew’s earlier drawings of this woman?

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: No, he took it all with him when he left.

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSIE FREEMAN
utterance.content: You might want to check the portfolio with his application for Barker. All the work he cared about he put in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Rosie, we’ll look into it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, no Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he had a late night. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was talking to the Pennsylvania state police about our victim's mystery woman. Police said I was the second person to call in the last two weeks about the woman they found in the woods.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they tell you who else called?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jonas Westfall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep, our werewolf. And the forensics expert determined that the woman died eighteen years ago from a gunshot wound to the chest, from a nine millimetre handgun. The same as Damon. So I thought what the hell, compare the ballistics. The bullets? Are a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two murders that many years apart. Anything on the mystery woman?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, still haven’t ID’d her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Crow would have been two years old when that woman was killed. Do you remember anything from when you were that young?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crow’s portfolio?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, and there’s something you’ve got to see.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle, Alexis OK?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She is, she’s a smart kid. You took care of Feggin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he’s either a feminist or he’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s Alan’s original last name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: McGinty. And I think he was hiding something. Alan’s first wife, Elizabeth McGinty, went missing from Summit, New Jersey eighteen years ago. She was never found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alan lied to us. He knew exactly who his son was drawing. He was drawing his real mother.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And Summit’s only a couple of hours from where the body was found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Question mark. Remember what I told you about gravestones telling stories?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crow came here for a reason.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The cemetery manager said that the family had a memorial service for their daughter about five years after she went missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damon must have looked at hundreds of reconstructed faces researching his thesis. I can’t imagine the shock when he recognised one as the woman from Crow’s drawings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crow must have realised his family had been lying to him all these years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh, fresh flowers on her grave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crow brought his father here to confront him with his mother’s grave.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: I was protecting my family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were protecting yourself. You’re a cold-blooded killer, you killed your wife, and then you reported her missing, and then eighteen years later when your son found out you killed him as well.

utterance.speaker: LAWSON
utterance.content: You don’t have to respond to that.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: No, no, no she’s accusing me of killing my son. Yes, I lied to Matthew, but I did it to protect him. I thought he was too young to understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were a suspect.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: Of course I was a suspect! I was her husband. There wasn’t any evidence to tie me to her disappearance because I had nothing to do with it. When Janice and I got married it was like a chance, a chance at a fresh start.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So as soon as you were legally able, you married your nanny.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: Janice was there for us during a very dark time in our lives. We had press on the lawn and there were days without sleep. I was handing out fliers with Lizzie’s picture on it, and Janice kept it together and she protected Matthew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why would you lie to us?

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: You told us in front of our daughter. What, did you want me to tell her that everything she thought was a lie? Rosie adored Matthew. She’d just found out he’d died, what would you have done?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would have told her the truth.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: He was nine years old when he first drew her face. He showed it to me. I thought I was seeing a ghost. Then I figured she was still somewhere in his head from his early memories, but we’d been living a lie for so long that it had become the truth, so how could I possibly tell him that Janice wasn’t his mother? That his real mother ran away.

utterance.speaker: LAWSON
utterance.content: Are we through here, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not by a long shot, Lawson. The Connecticut state police found a nine millimetre hand gun in your client's home, and I am just betting that that is the same gun that killed Elizabeth Dryden McGinty and Jonas Westfall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, and there is also this. Your son witnessed his mother's murder.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: No, that’s not possible. How is this possible?

utterance.speaker: JANICE FREEMAN
utterance.content: Excuse me. How much longer are you going to keep us waiting without telling us what is going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We are trying to find the answers, Mrs Freeman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Spots.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "Spots all over, blood all over, I should have buried you then, you wicked boy."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Morlock’s crazy talk, it’s just like Paige’s drunk talk, you have to translate it. Is Morlock still in holding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mrs Freeman, I’m sorry this is taking so long but as long as you have to wait you might as well be comfortable. Have you seen our vending machines?

utterance.speaker: MORLOCK
utterance.content: Murderous *****. Spots murdered the Crow. Murderer, murderer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What a small world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: Thank you. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She killed Elizabeth so that she could have you to herself. And then she murdered Matthew and his friend Damon so that you would never find out. Matthew didn’t know who to trust so he asked Damon to hide the evidence, which turned out to be smarter than he ever realised. She knew it was only a matter of time before they figured out the truth about what she had done. So she followed Damon to his apartment and shot him. She used the same gun she used to kill your first wife.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: What about my son?

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: She raised him, she was like his mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was a constant reminder of what she had done. And when he turned on her, she wasn’t his mother anymore.

utterance.speaker: ALAN FREEMAN
utterance.content: It’s OK, honey. It’s OK, honey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It will for a little while. And then one day she’ll wake up and it will just be a part of her life. Who knows? Maybe she’ll become a writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you still haven’t told me where your fascination with murder comes from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was five years old. We were summering in the Hamptons. I was pretty much left to my own devices. This one day I was walking along the beach, I was miles from where I’d started. I was just about to turn back when I saw something had washed up on the beach I though maybe it’s a whale or a turtle or a sea lion, so I ran over to see what it was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a boy, my age. It was our housekeeper's son. It must have just happened 'cause the tide hadn’t washed away all the blood. We had just played hide and go seek just the day before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened to him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They never found out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You made that up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s what I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? You are so getting it for that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, you’re not in your costume.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m going to stay upstairs. I’m not really in a party mood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Paige was so angry with me she sabotaged our science project. She killed Feggin. She said it was an accident, but I know she did it on purpose to get back at me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that is so wrong on so many levels.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How could she take care of him the way we did and then just destroy him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know - it’s just, it’s one reason I write about it. The way some people behave just bewilders me. Let me tell you this, though -- there is nothing you could do that would stop me from protecting you, or supporting you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even if you get an F. Now, go get changed. The goblins and ghouls will be arriving soon. You’ve got a spider on you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Careful, that is a potion of my own concoction. Drink it, and who knows who or what you will become. Also, you might wonder what happened to your pants.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’ve always told him, if you are going to do something, do it big or don’t do it at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She said she wasn’t sure she’d make it. She had some paperwork to finish up, but it’s still early.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sound so disappointed, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I said costumes were mandatory. I mean dress up, you know, be a little scary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I was going for sexy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now we’re even.
